Charlie and Chris fish for Mahi-Mahi and Yellow Eye Snapper. Angela and Charlie check out the local scene in Atlantis. The chef prepares the freshly-caught Mahi-Mahi and Snapper. Angela and Charlie critique the sushi from Nobu.

programme.title: M-1 Challenge #65
programme.desc: M-1 Challenge is an MMA competition organized with a series of events held in many places around the world. The shows feature the best local and international fighters with spectacular Kos and submissions.

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: Masabumi Hosono
programme.desc: The only Japanese passenger on Titanic helped save lives, but was ostracized back in his home country for the rest of his life. There’s been many published accounts about Hosono, but now Robert Bracken gives us the real story.

programme.title: Captain Smith's Saturday Afternoon Ice Briefing
programme.desc: Lightoller’s testimony before the commission confirms Captain Smith’s ice briefing to his officers long before Titanic reached the ice field.

programme.title: Matching Shoes What Else Can That Be?
programme.desc: Ken Marschall, who’s been to the Titanic wreck six times, remembers standing at the door of Robert Ballard’s office and telling him, “I’ve found the bodies...”

programme.title: The Captain's Table
programme.desc: First class trans-Atlantic travel is synonymous with fine dining. For the select few, the ultimate dining experience is to be invited to the Captain’s table. Sauder takes us back in time and gives us a seat at Captain Smith’s table.

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: Titanic’s Pumps
programme.desc: Titanic’s engineers have always been an enduring story as they struggled with the pumps downstairs trying to keep them going to the very end. Was there ever any hope in their heroism?

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Submarine Signals
programme.desc: In 1912, the greatest threat to shipping was not ice - it was fog. Bill Sauder explains how submarine signaling helped navigate ships like Titanic through treacherous waters.

programme.title: Titanic's Morse Lamps
programme.desc: Before radio, ships had to communicate with each other visually. During the day they used hand flags and at night it was through morse lamps. Bill Sauder explains Titanic’s Lamps: where they were located and how they were used.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Should Titanic Have Turned into the Iceberg?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson takes on the popular controversy that instead of trying to avoid the iceberg, maybe Titanic should have just turned directly into it? Could this have really saved Titanic?

programme.title: Forward A Deck Promenade
programme.desc: It’s always been suggested that H&W decided to enclose the forward end of Titanic’s A deck promenade because Olympic’s first-class passengers had complained about sea spray. Mark Chirnside believes that might not be the reason and he explains why.

programme.title: Mystery Stairs On Titanic
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host Bill Sauder tells us that like any great English house, Titanic had her quirks; including hallways that seem to go nowhere and staircases that served no purposes. What were they thinking? Sauder will explain!

programme.title: The Anchor Crane Mystery - Ken Marschall
programme.desc: When the first images of Titanic came back in 1985, everyone noticed how the bow anchor crane was turned to a very unusual position; even considering the crash into the ocean floor. Jim Cameron’s got one theory about what happened and Ken Marschall’s...

programme.title: Another View on the Coal Burning Fire
programme.desc: A recent documentary presented new theories about the coal burning fire onboard Titanic. Parks Stephenson gives his view of the fire and how it affected Titanic. Senan Molony and Parks Stephenson, two of our hosts, are on Titanic’s center stage!

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Archibald Gracie’s Last Letter
programme.desc: Host Andrew Aldridge reveals a remarkable letter written by Archibald Gracie barely eight weeks before he died. It was written to fellow Carpathia passenger Louis Ogden, who was responsible for some of the iconic photographs taken of Titanic survivors...

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: Photographing Titanic
programme.desc: We have so few photographs of Titanic. Collector, Craig Sopin, believes there may be more out there, possibly even in the debris ﬁeld. In this episode, he gives us a rare glimpse of workers photographed on the grand staircase.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: Nazi Germany’s Version of Titanic
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes of the German movie “Titanic” — commissioned by Nazi Propaganda Minister Joseph Goebbels. German Titanic Society President Malte Fiebing-Petersen tells the unique story behind the film— from a script based on a Jewish...

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Elevator Grills
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Expedition Canada Season 1 Ep 8 (Eng)
programme.desc: Race Day (part 2). Fast water and flowy single track makes for some epic conditions for the teams pushing toward the finish line at the 2022 Expedition Canada. Cacti and sprinklers launch an attack on competitors and the race team, Dan realizes why drysuits were listed as a mandatory item, and Expedition Canada welcomes its champions that have been racing for 3-5 days, non stop.

programme.title: Capraia Island Adventure Part 1 (Eng)
programme.desc: Round the wild untouched island of Capraia off the Tuscan coast of Italy on a small boat with an expert guide and up close to the coast to see the geologic and historical secrets of the island

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2023 - Episode 11
programme.desc: We commence this episode by journeying to Spain for the Palma Marathon Mallorca, celebrating its 19th edition this year. Next stop is Portugal and the TRITON World Series, renowned in the triathlon scene, which concluded its 2023 season in the Algarve region. Our adventure continues in Croatia, where Istria300 has burgeoned into Europes fastest-growing cycling project. The third edition attracted 2,800 participants from 40 countries to Porec. Next we move to Italy for a short presentation of the Dobbiaco-Cortina Cross Country Race 2024. Then we shift to France for the Equestrian European Championship Sports. We conclude our episode in Saudi Arabia with Tough Mudder obstacle course races which will happen soon in AlUla.

programme.title: The First Second - Armel Le Cléac'h E
programme.desc: Armel Le Cléach creates his victories thanks to a strong relationship with the whole team of which he is the extension ... But for this navigator engaged in a daunting battle with the ocean on a giant 32-meter trimaran, each course towards a new start is a new battle with the unknown, with his own will and with his primary adversary: himself.

programme.title: Recon Chrono Climb Tarvisio-Lussari Giro D'italia 2023 (Eng)
programme.desc: Complete Exclusive recon of the 20th stage of the Giro dItalia from Tarvisio to Monte Lussari by the famous commentator and Cyclist Ilenia Lazzaro and cycling cross world champion Daniele Pontoni. The chrono sprint stage up Mount Lussari is the latest designed by Enzo Cainero, the great driving force behind the Friulian stages of the Giro dItalia.

programme.title: Deutschland Tour 2023
programme.desc: The Deutschland Tour takes place for the fifth time in 2023. Bigger and more colorful than ever. From August 23 to 27, the Deutschland Tour 2023 connects German cities and regions with an opening timetrial and four challenging stages.

programme.title: Titan Desert Morocco 2019
programme.desc: A look back at the 2019 edition of the Garmin Titan Desert, a six-stage mountain bike race in the Moroccan desert. Orientation and endurance are two essential assets for a course that will make you discover the most incredible landscapes of Morocco over nearly 640 kilometers.

programme.title: E-Mountain Bike World Cup 2024 Rd3&4 Germany (Eng)
programme.desc: Welcome to WES round 3 and 4 of the UCI E-Mountain Bike Cross-Country World Cup in Bielstein, Germany, for the second year in a row. Das Bergisches region is the beautiful scenario hosting this event, in the woods of the Motocross venue "Bielsteiner Waldkurs", one of Europes oldest motocross circuits.

programme.title: The Traka 2024 - the unexpected ride (Eng)
programme.desc: The Traka is a non-competitive bicycle outing that takes place on gravel roads, stretches of asphalt roads, and trails completely open to the transit of any other vehicle, such as trucks, tractors, hunters, locals, or tourists. The Trakas participants numbers doubled year after year exponentially, making Girona the epicenter of European gravel. The 2024 edition gathered athletes from 77 nationalities on this 345km / 3700mD+ course. Josh was one of them and we follow his adventure and suffering on this gravel bike challenge.

programme.title: Cro Race 2023 Stage 4
programme.desc: Cro Race 2023 Stage 4 : KRK - LABIN

programme.title: Cro Race 2023 Stage 2
programme.desc: Cro Race 2023 Stage 2 : BIOGRAD NA MORU - NOVALJA

programme.title: Santos Tour Down Under women 2025
programme.desc: The Santos Tour Down Under womens race happening in South Australia is first on the UCI international cycling calendar. Tougher climbs and longer stages await riders as the Santos Tour Down Under women’s race returns for its third year at the highest level of international competition.

programme.title: Solaris Yachts - The Shipyards
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you to Aquileia, for an exclusive visit inside the Solaris shipyard. Historically well-known as a sailboat manufacturer, has recently started building motorboats. Discover it with The Boat Show.

programme.title: Salon Nautique de Paris 2021 - Inflatable boats
programme.desc: This is the first Salon Nautique that our Bacci del Buono has ever attended, and he is looking for a few special boats. Discover them with The Boat Show.

programme.title: Hallberg Rassy - The Shipyard
programme.desc: Hallberg-Rassy is a company is based in Ellos, Sweden, and it has been building sailing boats since 1943. It is specialised in building bluewater sailing yachts. Our Federico Maselli is on-site to Show you around.

programme.title: Jeanneau 55 - Boot 2023
programme.desc: Hop on board the Jeanneau 55, presented at the Boot in Dusseldorf. This incredible sailboat is destined to leave a mark, discover why with Antonio Vettese.

programme.title: Oceanis 37.1 First Line - Walkthrough
programme.desc: Hop-on board as Antonio Vettese walks us through a new ambitious boat from the Beneteau Group, Oceanis 37.1 First Line.

programme.title: A special novelty
programme.desc: In America there is a high demand for sailboats, and people are queuing to visit the Lagoon 46, a high quality catamaran that is a performant and spacious novelty.

programme.title: MJM Yachts
programme.desc: A tour of the amazing factory of MJM Yachts, a company that meets the highest expectations for performance, usability, quality, and fuel efficiency.

programme.title: Roxtec (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you behind the scenes of a very successful company. We are talking about Roxtec, world leader in sealing systems for pipe and cable passages.

programme.title: Esthec
programme.desc: Esthec is a company that produces coverings for the decks of all boats. Their innovative flooring is a sustainable and resistant material, suitable for the construction of bridges, decks, interiors and exteriors of yachts and for other types of boat.

programme.title: All about Brunswick - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the Miami Boat Show and she is about to have a chat with David Foulkes, CEO of Brunswick Corporation.

programme.title: Riviera Belize 66 Daybridge - Built for cruising
programme.desc: Sam Orani invites you on board the Riviera Belize 66 Daybridge, on show at the Fort Lauderdale International. This is a very social boat, ideal for cruising.

programme.title: Wider Yachts - Marcello Maggi
programme.desc: The Boat Show has prepared for you an exclusive interview with Marcello Maggi, from Wider Yachts.

programme.title: MJM – Factory Tour
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is inside the MJM Boats shipyard for an exclusive tour to discover the production process, design and technology that make MJM one of the most authoritative names in motor boating.

programme.title: Denison Yachting - Miami 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the Miami International Boat Show and she is about to Interview Bob Denison, CEO Denison Yachting.

programme.title: Seakeeper 2 - on board Beneteau Flyer 9
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono is on board the Beneteau Flyer 9 to explain the functioning of the Seakeeper 2, a system that aims to reduce the onboard rolling up to 95.

programme.title: Greenline 39 Hybrid - Annapolis Boat Show
programme.desc: Back in 2008, Greenline pioneered hybrid technology and today they present you with the new Greenline 39 Hybrid, seen at the Annapolis Boat Show 2022.

programme.title: Salerno Boat Show - 2021
programme.desc: Our Maria Elisa Altese takes you to Marina DArechi, a modern strategic port just a few miles from the Amalfi Coast. This is where the fifth edition of the Salerno Boat Show takes place, an appointment that over the years has become a reference point for boat enthusiasts in central and southern Italy.

programme.title: Rendez-V Marine - 2023 (Eng)
programme.desc: Discover the sixteenth edition of the Rendez-V Marine, an event organized by V Marine and dedicated to the owners and enthusiasts of Azimut Yachts and Pirelli Speedboats.

programme.title: Xenta and Castoldi - Teamwork
programme.desc: Hop on board the Castoldi JT 34 Open Limo and discover a new way of handling your boat. The one you are about to see is equipped with a Castoldi waterjet engine, while the command is from Xenta. Accuracy and safety are guaranteed.

programme.title: Wallypower58 Power - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Hop on board the Wallypower58 Power, newly arrived in America. Bill Hackett interviews Stefano De Vivo.

programme.title: Raymarine - YachtSense Ecosystem
programme.desc: Hop on the FIM Regina 470 to test Raymarine’s full optional onboard electronics.

programme.title: MarineMax - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the MIBS to discover all about MarineMax, one of the key players in the boating and marine industry.

programme.title: Felci Yacht Design
programme.desc: The Boat Show interviews for you the architect Umberto Felci, one of the most important designers of sailing yachts, founder with the engineer Lorenzo Giovannozzi of Felci Yacht Design, a design and engineering company in the most diverse areas of sailing boats.

programme.title: Delfino Verde Deluxe
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you aboard the Delfino Verde Deluxe, equipped with the Volvo Penta IPS propulsion system.

programme.title: Venice Boat Show 2021 - part 2
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese and Federico Maselli take you to the Venice Boat Show. In this second part, they will show you the other protagonists of this years edition. Discover them with The Boat Show.

programme.title: How to - Anchor with Raymarine
programme.desc: Welcome to another appointment with "How to". In this episode Bacci Del Buono explains how to correctly set the alarm for anchoring.

programme.title: Eng 3 Apartment Fire Part 1
programme.desc: The crew of Engine 3s "A" Shift start their day with some of the best tacos in town, a call comes for a fire; the arrive on-scene to a mattress fire possibly set by a homeless person. Then a call comes in for a structure fire. They arrive on scene to a second floor apartment. Captain Palmer takes Command and his crew go into action. Firemen is Garcia on the pump panel, Firefighter Silva pulls the nozzle up the steps, and safely puts on his PPE and they head into the fire.Arson investigation arrives on scene. Back at the station, a quick bit of food, and another call comes in for a structure fire and the Palmer and the crew head out the door.

programme.title: First 24 with Engine 3
programme.desc: Night - Engine 3s Crew gets a few calls. A call comes in for a commercial structure fire, its a guy whos a hoarder. Sparks fly as they gain entry on A, B and D sides. It takes the Fire Crew all night to fight the fire.

programme.title: Engines 3 and 9
programme.desc: We finish up a 24 hour shift with the crew from Engine 9 who finish with a morning structure fire. The next 24 hours back at Station 9 with firefighter Robert Castillion, he just made Captain at the busiest station in Fresno, Station 3. Garcia is the Engineer. A call comes in, its a rubbish fire. Its Night, we are back at Station 9, to find the crew in the engine bay doing todays exercise. Then, the call comes in, with both engine companies responding. Engine 3 is on-scene with Truck 4 when Engine 9 arrives. Tonight they are testing out some Key Combat Ready Hose line, it pulls out great; they are in on this mattress wherehouse fire for a little while.

programme.title: Rainbow Reef Relaxation 1
programme.desc: Sit back, relax and enjoy the dazzling world of coral reefs in 4K you embark on a journey through some of the most vibrant underwater reefs on our blue planet - including many scenes which no longer look like this due to coral bleaching. From the cinematographer: "The footage for this film was shot over a period of some years in French Polynesia, Micronesia, Indonesia and East Timor. Unfortunately there are not that vibrant anymore today. Coral reefs have suffered from the rise of water temperature, rise in acidity, destructive fishing methods and severe storms caused by climate change." - Peter Schneider. "Rainbow Reef Relaxation" is a 3-hour long, sweeping yet majestic & vibrant underwater journey to the world's most beautiful lagoons, as captured by Nature Relaxation collaborator Peter Schneider (Underwatercam) paired with ambient underwater sounds and brand new ambient music by the Cynic Project. Filmed in High Definition several years ago, thanks to its age this film offers magical glimpses of an underwater world that is bursting with life, color, and beauty.

programme.title: Kapas Biru Waterfall: Indonesia
programme.desc: Escape to Indonesia with tropical vegetation and a spectacular rushing waterfall.

programme.title: Lombok Beaches: Indonesia

programme.title: Jodie Devos, Anaik Morel & David Violi - Tribute to French Romanticism at Venice
programme.desc: Salon Romantique à Venise salutes the work of the Palazzetto Bru Zane foundation which aims to contribute to the rediscovery of a neglected part of the French musical heritage running from Louis XVi to WW I. This concert offers a journey into the French romantic repertoire performed by pianist David Violi (piano), Jodie Devos (soprano) and Anaik Morel (mezzo-soprano). The program contains some of the most beloved French arias, such as 'Seguedille' from Bizet's Carmen by Bizet, the Flower Duet from Delibes' Lakmé and 'Mon cœur s’ouvre à ta voix' from Saint-Saëns Samson et Dalila. Recorded at the Palazzetoo Bru Zane in Venice, Italy in 2016.

programme.title: Nikolay Lugansky - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Herbert Blomstedt & Gewandhausorchester Leipzig - Symphonies in D by Mozart and Voríšek
programme.desc: Conductor Herbert Blomstedt and the Gewandhausorchester take us on a musical journey to the Czech Republic in this 2020 concert from Leipzig’s Gewandhaus. The program opens with Bohemian composer Jan Václav Hugo Voríšek’s Symphony in D major, Op. 23 (1821). Although the composition – Voríšek’s only symphony – was never performed during the composer’s lifetime, it has become one of his most-performed works today. Also on the program is Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart’s Symphony No. 38 in D major, K. 504. This work, which premiered while Mozart was visiting Prague in 1787, is often referred to as the ‘Prague Symphony’.

programme.title: Seong-Jin Cho - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Federico Guglielmo & Roberto Loreggian - Works by Matteis, Tartini, Bach & Vivaldi
programme.desc: The six-concert series “Io suono italiano” is dedicated to music of Italian composers and performed by Italian musicians on Italian instruments. The concert programs cover four centuries of music: from Girolamo Frescobaldi and Antonio Vivaldi to more contemporary music by Ennio Morricone and Azio Corghi. Each program presents more familiar pieces alongside lesser-known compositions. These performances were filmed at the atmospheric Teatro Sociale in Rovigo, Italy, in January 2021. In this program, Federico Guglielmo (violin) and Roberto Loreggian (harpsichord) present Baroque music. On the program are Nicola Matteis’s Passaggio rotto e Andamento veloce per violino solo (from Ayres for the Violini), Giuseppe Tartini’s Sonata in G minor Op. 1 No. 10 (B.g10) “Didone abbandonata”, J. S. Bach’s Concerto in F major for solo harpsichord, BWV 978 (a transcription of Antonio Vivaldi’s Violin Concerto in G major, Op. 3 No. 3, RV 310), and Vivaldi’s Sonata IV in D major, RV 755.

programme.title: Jodie Devos - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Quatuor Ebène - Beethoven - String Quartet No. 7 & 13, and Op. 133
programme.desc: Renowned French string quartet Quatuor Ébène marked the 250th birth anniversary of Ludwig van Beethoven (1770-1827) with a remarkable project: recording all of the great composer’s sixteen string quartets. For five years, violinists Pierre Colombet and Gabriel Le Magadure, violist Marie Chilemme, and cellist Raphaël Merlin immersed themselves in Beethoven’s 650 pages of sheet music. Their efforts culminated in the performance of the composer’s complete repertoire for string quartet, which covers three decades of Beethoven's musical creativity, during six impressive concerts at Philharmonie de Paris in the autumn of 2020. Quatuor Ébène explored every facet of Beethoven's string quartet repertoire: from the youthful Opus 18 string quartets to the Razumovsky, Harp, and Serioso quartets (Opus 59, 74, and 95) from his middle period, and finally, the depth of his late quartets (Opus 127 to 135). This program features Quatuor Ébène performing Beethoven’s String Quartet No. 7 in F major, Op. 59, No. 1, known as “Razumovsky”; String Quartet No. 13 in B-flat major, Op. 130; and the monumental Great Fugue, Op. 133. This concert performance was recorded at Philharmonie de Paris on October 12, 2020.

programme.title: Art Farmer, Jim Hall, Steve Swallow & Pete La Roca - The Art Farmer Quartet live In England
programme.desc: Art Farmer: Live in '64 highlights an amazing one-hour concert featuring the great flugelhornist in his prime. Farmer’s band includes legendary guitarist Jim Hall (fresh from Sonny Rollins’ band), drummer Pete LaRoca, and Steve Swallow on bass. The legendary ensemble plays both standards and originals with ease and finesse and highlights why Farmer was considered one of the most innovative horn players in all of jazz.

programme.title: Bill Evans - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Thelonious Monk, Charlie Rouse, Ben Riley & Larry Gales - Episode 1: Thelonious Monk - Jazz Greats
programme.desc: The idiosyncratic pianist and composer Thelonious Monk (1917-1982) is one of the all-time greats of jazz. His music went largely misunderstood for the first 15 years of his career, after which he was rightly hailed as a genius, and received credit as a founding father of bebop. Several concerts from his 1966 European tour were recorded for television, featuring his quartet of Charles Rouse (tenor saxophone), Lawrence Gales (bass) and Benjamin Riley (drums). His quartet performed Epistrophy, 'Round Midnight, and Lulu's Back in Town in Warsaw for Polish television on April 4, 1966. On April 17, the same quartet performed a short set in Copenhagen for Danish television, featuring Lulu's Back in Town, Don't Blame Me, and Epistrophy.

programme.title: Yumi Ito - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Sammy Davis Jr - Sammy Davis Jr. - Concertgebouw Amsterdam
programme.desc: The Royal Concertgebouw in Amsterdam is a world-renowned concert hall, known for its first-rate acoustics. It has attracted many famous performers over the years and is one of the Netherlands' most treasured musical institutions. On May 28, 1967, American singer and actor Sammy Davis Jr. appeared at the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam for a live, nationwide TV broadcast. Supported by his band conducted by George Rhodes, Davis Jr. combined his singing talent and infectious sense of humor as he covered songs from a variety of genres.

programme.title: Rahsaan Roland Kirk - DJAZZ Clips

programme.title: Freddie Hubbard, Al Grey, Alvin Batiste & Al Casey - Freddie Hubbard & The Satchmo Legacy Live in 1987
programme.desc: Since 1977, Estival is a summer jazz festival in Switzerland, Lugano. Estival offers a thrilling and particularly surprising line-up that explores the rich world of contemporary music whilst promoting the understanding of different cultures, tolerance, and co-existence. This concert of Freddie Hubbard and the Satchmo Legacy in 1987, highlights the bebop legend's classic style and silky tone. Hubbard is an American jazz trumpeter whose unmistakable and influential tone contributed to new perspectives for modern jazz and bebop. He was also a well-known part of Art Blakey and the Jazz Messengers and is primarily known for playing bebop, hard bop, and post-bop styles from the early '60s onwards.

Polheim
programme.desc: Polheim tells the story of three young explorers given a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity; to ski across Antarctica with the Antarctic Heritage Trust’s Inspiring Explorers Expedition™ to the South Pole in celebration of 150 years since the birth of Roald Amundsen, the first person to reach the bottom of the world. Not only will they have the physical challenge of 'man-hauling' sleds nearly 1000km in extreme weather conditions, they will also face an internal battle - 50 days of isolation in the most remote environment on the planet, with team members who are essentially strangers. The film explores themes of mortality, ambition, family and the history of polar exploration. Spirit of Adventure Award - New Zealand International Mountain Film Festival 2024. Official Selections 2024: Vancouver International Mountain Film Festival, London Mountain Film Festival.

programme.title: The Church of the Open Sky
programme.desc: An inspired and endearing representation of the surfing experience, where all participants are worthy and welcomed to learn, play and grow together in inclusive, sacred playgrounds beneath The Church Of The Open Sky. A luscious visual love poem that explores gratefully lived surfing journeys.

programme.title: Shifting Ice + Changing Tides
programme.desc: Shifting Ice and Changing Tides is a human and wind powered, female led, ski and sail expedition to the west coast of Greenland. In this remote, fascinating and beautiful region, six women will explore and ski first descents while limiting their environmental footprint by sailing and climbing. The expedition will serve as a platform for raising awareness about climate change and environmental issues as well as for inspiring and promoting female participation in snow sports adventures. This is their story.

programme.title: Upper Peninsula Backcountry
programme.desc: At the end of the day, snowboarding is really about having a fun time with your friends. So whether these guys find a fun line to ride or not, they are having a good time in the search for the elusive Upper Peninsula Backcountry. Backcountry snowboarding is growing in popularity as people are getting tired of high prices and huge crowds at the ski resort. Snowboarders are also finding that the backcountry offers more of a connection to nature, which some find very appealing. “Backcountry” for the sake of this movie simply means anywhere in nature that is not within bounds of a ski resort.

programme.title: Being Hear
programme.desc: For most of his life, Gordon Hempton has been in pursuit of nature’s myriad and multi-faceted sounds.

programme.title: Pathfinder
programme.desc: Pathfinder - Life Beyond Fear. Pathfinder is a tale about the human spirit. The film follows six world-class slackliners (Highliners) on a mission deep into the Norwegian mountains to attempt something that's never been seen before: Walking a thin line, elevated in the vastness between two colossal cliffs, illuminated only by the mystical northern lights. The yearning that drives adventurers and explorers to climb the highest peaks, sail endless oceans, and cross vast deserts in the name of progress, is the same passion that drives these slack-liners to attempt what has still been unclaimed. Through the extreme conditions and endless challenges, we learn about their elemental desire to explore the limits of humankind. Finalist - New York Cinematography Awards 2021. Best Doc - European Cinematography Awards 2021. Best Film - Forence Film Awards 2020. Jury Choice Winner - FFTG Awards 2021. Best International Film - Venice Film Awards 2020. First Place - Short Film Competition 2020. Best Documentary - AXD Short Film Festival 2020. Best Short Film - Inkafest 2020. Best of Fest - Rome Independent Prisma Awards 2020. Official Selections 2021: Flathead Lake International Cinemafest, Hospitalet de Llobregat International Film Festival. Official Selections 2020: BANFF, Kendal Mountain Festival, Lisbon Film Rendezvous, Hollyweed Film Festival, Arica Nativa Rural Film Festival, Dalmatia Film Festival, Cortomontagna, Wild & Scenic Film Festival, Backcountry Film Festival, Anchorage International Film Festival, Yellowknife International Film Festival.

programme.title: Issaya
programme.desc: The dining room is a daring mix of classic and modern furniture on terracotta tile floors with unusually colourful wallpapers. The whole room basks in a very soft light and the result works surprising well. The menu, both in Thai and English, is not illustrated but cleverly written, keeping the phonetic dish names instead of an elaborated but hard to visualize description. The wine list is substantial and several excellent wines are available by the glass.

programme.title: The Mystical town of San Sebastian del Oeste, Mexio
programme.desc: Teri travels to San Sebastian del Oeste, an hour outside of Puerto Vallarta to experience the old mining town covered with pine, coffee and avocado trees. Here she learns the origin of the avocado, called aguacate (in Spanish) that was taken from the Nahuatl word of Āhuacatl (native Aztec language) which means "testicle tree".

programme.title: Redbird
programme.desc: If youve ever wanted to eat a standout meal from a veteran chef on the grounds of an old Baroque-style cathedral—and who hasnt?—Redbird can offer you that unique experience. The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.title: Duncan Lin
programme.desc: The Story of Duncan Lin“From my earliest memory, I have always liked drawing, but have never thought about making it my career,” says Duncan Lin, one of Taiwan’s most popular comics artists from Hualien. With a fanbase of 20 million and growing, Duncan has been approached by various renowned companies, such as Line, Asus, and TVBS for creative collaborations. He uses a caricature of himself as the main protagonist in his comics, which are centered around the hilarious going-ons of his daily life. With the cameras rolling, he wears his character as a mask, not wishing to expose his face. He is about 5’3, with a skinny frame, his dyed blonde hair peeking out from behind his mask. “My father always objected to my interest in drawing, but my mother was rather supportive. Some of my most precious memories are of those childhood drawings. I would show them to my mother, deeply excited, and she would look at them and say, ‘Oh, that’s [a] really nice picture’, and then display it on the fridge using a magnet. And I would feel so proud every time she did this. I would think, ‘Wow, I need to draw more, because I want more things to be displayed on the fridge’, and then slowly…. the fridge got filled up. And the old drawings would be removed, and the whole process would be repeated. And this small matter, and that fridge, they influenced me, and allowed me to feel like perhaps I should continue drawing in the future.”On the other hand, Duncan’s father was a strict figure, quite the opposite of his mother. “My father never smiled at me from the day I was born till the day he passed away. He never genuinely smiled at me and was always kind of distant - he’s a very, very strict kind of father - so we never really talked much, and of course after I graduated from high school, I left home.” Like all typical Asian parents, Duncan’s father hammered the notion: ‘do not pursue art because you’ll starve to death’, and that if he became an artist, ‘you’ll only earn money after you’re dead’.During his university years, Duncan majored i

programme.title: Behold One Of The World's Most Dangerous Travel Attractions
programme.desc: This is perhaps the worlds scariest hike.

programme.title: Panoramic Paramotoring
programme.desc: It consists of a tricycle, an engine powering a propeller that fills a canopy and - thankfully- a back-up canopy. One of the smallest aircraft in the world, Paramotors are the latest way to take to the skies above Dubais sand dunes. And as its wing rises, so does Euronews James OHagans nerves: "My pilot Jos assures me he’s never needed it ( the backup wing)." The morning mist clears and Jos Vandenbroucke, General manager pf Paramotor Desert Adventure, has given the word to go ahead. "Ready for rock and roll? he says. "We’re like 40/50 metres. No more. We can easily go up to 12,000 feet. In case we have an engine failure, it’s just doing this (Jos turns off engine)." Paramotors are one of the smallest aircraft in the world and have a great safety record because the engine is only needed for gaining altitude and can be switched off when you come back down to land. "We will do a spiral. If you can’t hold it anymore James, you just shout." "Now we do a 360 to the right. Yalla, here we go!" "The G-force in your stomach is class!" says OHagan. Flying over a stretch of desert reserve, you can see an array of wildlife; families of camels, Arabian oryx and even a tower of giraffes. "After that, I think I can safely say that I’ve got over my fear of flying and kiss the ground," says OHagan.

programme.title: "This is insane" Supercar Blondie's F1 crash course
programme.desc: Euronews Evan Bourke joins social media star, Supercar Blondie , to test drive an F1 racing car in Dubai. Shes become a social media sensation for testing out some of the worlds most beautiful cars, so what better way to meet Supercar Blondie , than to propose a test drive in the ultimate racing machine - an F1 race car. Euronews Dubai based correspondent Evan Bourke was given the breathtakingly gruesome job -honestly, his colleagues are not jealous - of having to take part in the test drive at the Dubai Autodome . The race track is one of the few places in the world where it is possible to get in an F1 car and experience the adrenaline rush that 6G and more than 500 horsepower has to offer. Supercarblondie has six million Instagram followers and is known for her love of Supercars but even this was a first for her. To watch the full episode of Adventures, click on the video link above.

programme.title: Why day-trippers and holidaymakers are hooked on Dubai Marina
programme.desc: The glories of Dubai Marina Dubai Marina is much more than just a glamorous urban dock for luxury yachts (although its that as well!) Its also home to a huge range of chic bars and restaurants to suit all tastes and moods. And, of course, it has those iconic towers that define its famous skyline. One of the best ways to admire the architecture around Dubai Marina is from the deck of a boat. You can charter a private yacht, hop onboard an organised boat tour - or you can even cross the marina for as little as €2 in a water taxi. Five-star resorts hug the coastline. Their vast, marble-clad lobbies lead to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunch venues and postcard-perfect beaches. As for Dubai Marinas beach clubs, from Drift to Zero Gravity , they are dizzyingly beautiful; their pool decks are catwalks for the latest swimwear fashions. Jumereirah Beach Residence Jumeirah Beach Residence itself is the largest single-phase commercial and residential project in the world. Its strategically lined along a chic waterfront strip known as The Walk , feautring stunning 3D murals. The Walk has a very varied range of fashion, home and handicraft shops and boutiques. The outdoor pop-up market stalls offer jewellery, food treats and homeware, as well as performances by street entertainers. Jumereirah Beach Residence is made up of 40 high-rise buildings divided into six clusters, all with superb access to first-class retailers, entertainment venues and restaurants. Up on the Flying Cup The adjacent cosmopolitan shopping area The Beach has many attractions, including the floating adventure park Aqua Fun . This amazing water park makes a statement, by spelling out "I ♡ Dubai" via is pools and slides when seen from above. Another highlight at The Beach is The Flying Cup , a ride that you can sit in and be elevated to fabulous views, seen in all their glory from 40 metres up - while eating and drinking! From the top, you can see Ain Dubai, Palm Jumeirah and, of course, that wonderful Duba

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Theres the LA you see in the movies, and then theres the real LA—a gritty, fantastically diverse collection of neighborhoods sprawled between ocean and mountains, each with its own distinct mood. Los Angeles spent years striving to emulate towns like New York or San Francisco, but over the last decade the city took a long hard look in the mirror, dug what it saw, and started focusing on what it does best: casual, multicultural, and effortlessly cool.The new LA is the place everyone suddenly wants to be, where high and low converge on palm-lined sidewalks. The countrys most thriving food scene is here, run by a guerilla band of ethnically diverse chefs cooking up whatever they want, wherever they want, with the best produce in the world. From the industrial warehouses east of downtown to the beachside shopping meccas of Venice, LAs cutting edge street style, art scene, and culinary chops cant be contained—the creative energy pops through the concrete like ficus roots. And just to sweeten the deal, 280-plus days of breezy sunshine form the backdrop of it all. Just dont forget your shades.

programme.title: Shanghai Me - A taste of 1930's China
programme.desc: A favourite for Royalty, celebrities and sports stars, Shanghai Me transports its guests back in time to pre-war China. Taste finds out why this fine-dining restaurant has been voted one of the best in the gulf region. Shanghai in the 1930s was called the Paris of the East. One restaurant that’s capturing that flavour is Shanghai Me in Dubai’s financial district. Exuding the atmosphere the Orient, this establishment offers a unique dining experience. Euronews Evan Bourke paid a visit to meet Head Chef Shane Macneill, who cooked one of the restaurants signature dishes, black cod. Click on the video link above to watch the full episode.

programme.title: La Mer, Dubai’s newest beachfront neighbourhood, offers hip restaurants, water sports and fun parks
programme.desc: With the construction of Dubai’s latest luxury residential development, Port de La Mer by Meraas , and new hotel, Rove La Mer , La Mer is a of rising interest in today’s property market. La Mer, open since 2017, is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside neighbourhoods, nestled on the northern shoreline. Divided into two areas, La Mer South and La Mer North, it’s defined by its retro Californian style. The Instagram-friendly destination offers a heady mix of water sports, fun parks, fashionable restaurants, street art and seasonal parties after dark. By day, visitors can hire sunbeds or rent wooden day rooms on La Mer Beach. The multi-coloured beach huts house showers. La Mer beach club, Train , is fully licensed with a shisha area, but its name is derived from its fitness facilities – it has a gym and a boxing and yoga studio – and its Origin 33 restaurant and lounge also serves healthy meals and a menu of fresh juices and smoothies. The best restaurants in La Mer, according to local award-givers, include Masti , a beachfront eatery applauded for its modern Indian cuisine, innovative mixology and eclectic interior design by Studio Lotus. The name Masti is derived from the Hindi word for fun and mischief and the décor and dishes live up to the name, with cheeky monkey artwork and playful fusions for the palate such as the tandoori chicken bao. Another creative culinary outlet is iScream . Managing Partner Rami Halawi came up with the concept for iScream with his family. Offering a wide selection of unusual flavours is the brand’s unique selling point. “Here at iScream, we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, tabbouleh, ketchup and Mexican chilli-chocolate,” says Rami. On certain days, customers are invited to scream into a sound monitor for their ice cream – if they beat the highest recording in decibels, they win their ice cream for free. La Mer’s shops focus on beach pursuits and accessories, making it a good place to shop for swimwear, sunglasses, suntan lotion

programme.title: Karaiya Spice House
programme.desc: For those that like to feel the burn, make a trip to Karaiya Spice House for some Hunan-style heat. Authentic Hunan dishes are beautifully presented at this award winning, lair of spice. A bouquet of Hunan chilis accompanies many of Karaiya’s menu items, but the restaurant does offer milder fare to tame the flames. Signature items include smoked ribs, steamed fish with chilis and flame-baked prawns wrapped in foil. Located on the 3rd floor of Sanlitun Village, Karaiya will also win you over with its elegant and understated design. Just remember that “normal” here is still very spicy.

programme.title: Beijing
programme.desc: Being the capital of China is a colossal responsibility. With over a billion people watching, Beijing seems to manage the task with dignified ease. The pace of life in this city speaks volumes about its personality and its characters. The mood is steady, confident, and proud. With walls that never end, ducks that bear golden skin, and Forbidden Cities out in the open, Beijing has a storybook magic that can only be found in a megacity overflowing with such rich history and tradition. The landmarks and landscapes are dominant forces, followed by the new developments mounted by modernization. Knowing where to look will be the key to unlocking the cities best adventures and experiences. Don’t be afraid to explore the many interesting nooks and crannies of Beijing’s streets and alleys, as there are many. From the bucket list worthy monuments, to the waves of new restaurants, shops, and cultural encounters available, be sure not to rush. Beijing is a hotbed of commerce and entrepreneurship, and inspires the country’s top artists, students, writers, film-makers, musicians, and creatives to converge within its frontiers. With so much to explore in one of the oldest cities on the planet, traveling somewhere else seems irresponsible - there’s no place like ‘the capital.’

programme.title: Keeping tradition alive in Dubai
programme.desc: Tradition isnt exactly what first comes to mind when one thinks of Dubai, a city that quite literally grew out of the desert, but tourists are flocking to the Middle Eastern oasis for a taste of its Bedouin past. Camel races Old meets new can be seen at Dubais Camel Racing Club where these ships of the desert sprint across the perimeter of the famed Al Mamoom racetrack. Attracting both camel owners and punters alike, spectators can sit in their cars and drive alongside the camels as they hurtle towards the finish line, guided by a remote control jockey. Organisers say the event is a draw for tourists for a number of reasons. “When tourists come to the camel racing venues, they see something new. They see how people treat the camels and how the camels compete with each other. They also see how Emirati society promotes camels, says the clubs CEO and General Amanager Ali Saeed Bin Saroud. Camel racing was promoted by the former UAE president, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan as a way of bringing camels and back into mainstream Dubai culture. The Dubai Royal Family also actively support camel racing as a way of preserving the traditional Bedouin culture. Desert culture The Al Marmoom Heritage Festival is Dubai’s annual celebration of the traditional Arabian desert culture and vital role which it plays in the cultural identity of its people. Traditional markets, music and dancing are another way in which the Bedouin culture is kept alive and enjoyed by Dubai locals and tourists alike. Arabic hospitality German expat Ursula Musch moved to Dubai around 20 years ago after first visiting in 1993. She now breeds camels and encourages tourists to experience the Bedouin customs for themselves, as they, like her, may just find their passion in life. My passion or my message is I want to give foreigners, other people the chance to know something from the Arabic hospitality, from their tradition, from their culture, to show it to give it to other people who don’t

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.desc: Cereal Killer Cafes Alan Keery recommends fun & quirky places to eat in London. Check out the video for some exciting & unique restaurant options!

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Tulum
programme.desc: At its core Tulum is a vibrant mix of extremely old and extremely new. Prehistoric natural wonders and ancient Mayan ruins are scattered among world-class resorts slinging more fresh lobster and mezcal than the human body is probably meant to consume. Long known for its yoga retreats and rustic eco-hotels, the off-the-grid Tulum of 15 years ago is still there, but it now exists alongside thrumming nightlife and unparalleled culinary adventures. Chefs and mixologists from around the globe have been lured to Tulum by its beachside DGAF vibe and a willingness to rewrite the rules. There are plenty of destination-worthy bars and clubs near the city’s central Hotel Zone, but if you want to escape the glitz—or maybe civilization itself—plunge into one of the region’s underground swimming caves formed millions of years ago, believed by Mayans to be a passage to another dimension. With breathtaking beaches, history you can touch, and a unique kind of artistic-inspired luxury, Tulum is whatever you want it to be. Oh, and there are lots of tequila and tacos, too. Do take advantage of that.

programme.title: Hong Kong
programme.desc: From the simple perfection of summer boating, to the daily eruption of energy that is Lan Kwai Fong, Hong Kong has you covered an all things food, drink, entertainment, and lifestyle. The enchanting neighborhoods are coiled with history and culture, each with its own timeline of stories that speak persuasively about Hong Kong’s modernization. Situated against the backdrop of its secret cove-like harbor, the architecture that graces the land is just as extreme. Hong Kong sits atop the throne as the city with the most skyscrapers in the world, yet the urbanized areas are only a fraction of the city itself. The nature that surrounds and pushes through the city, gives Hong Kong it’s true indescribable magic. Denizens know where to find the hiking trails, the views, and escape routes to the open sea. The endless culinary delights, bold experiences, and hidden treasures make Hong Kong a torchbearer of culture, innovation, and lifestyle in Asia.

programme.title: Namie Osawa
programme.desc: You had me at, "Futuristic robots and sexy Japanese babes fighting off monsters!"We sat down with Namie Osawa, owner and founder of the world famous Robot Restaurant and her team. Namie’s futuristic robot-inspired venue is as visually stimulating as it is entertaining and interactive. She walks us through her inspiration for what now has become a staple experience for locals and global travellers.Interview: NAMIE OSAWA I opened Robot Restaurant three years ago. Even though I was hesitant to show the first concept to foreigners and so forth, I decided to open the restaurant in Kabukicho with the Japanese Businessman in mind. When thinking about what would be appealing to a businessman, I thought about Robots - which I longed for as a kid,..and Girls in sexy costumes. These were the things that initially came to mind. Our rehearsals begin at 11 o’clock in the morning including Wadaiko, which is a Japanese drum dance. We practice for about an hour and thirty minutes, then we have a brief meeting before the show. Rehearsals can be tough, but whatever we go over, ..it’s amazing and we have fun and I think it’s very good. Still, I think that there is a part where not a lot of the content catches on with the audience. Even after repeated viewings, I would like to think that each show was better than the one before it. But on the name alone, people were intrigued and when it arrived, it was beyond the imagination because I wanted it to be a thoughtful experience. Always keep going forward, it’s what we want out of this show. I want to make sure there’s more to it than just a name.

programme.title: Finding Your Fortune In Fintech: Opportunities in the Tech and Finance Industries
programme.desc: How do we ensure that the best among us are assured the opportunities they deserve in two of the hottest and highest paying industries in corporate America: technology and financial services, not to mention a market driver for both: financial technology or fintech? Join our panel of high-level corporate HR and diversity specialists for a frank, forward-looking discussion of collaborative, intentional, and results-oriented strategies to push black excellence through the executive opportunity pipeline.

programme.title: Check Yourself: Body Language Boot Camp Workshop II
programme.desc: What do your posture, walk, smile, smirk, punctuality, choice of clothes, and tech tools say about you? And is the message youre sending helpful or more a hindrance? Linda Clemons, CEO of Sisterpreneur, facilities a session to help you self-asses, self monitor, and self-correct so you can consistently project your best-self. Lessons learned from the 2020 Black Enterprise Women of Power Summit.

programme.title: Boyz-II-Men Talk Longevity After 25 Years in Show Business
programme.desc: On this edition of Our World with Black Enterprise, we sit down with Boyz-II-Men group to talk about longevity in the R&B arena. After nearly 25 years in the industry, Nathan Morris, Wanya Morris and Shawn Stockman remain one of the most iconic groups in the music history. Then we, we sit down with L.C.Johnson, Founding Editor of Colored Girl Confidential, and Angela Pitter, Founder of LiveWire Collaborative, to talk about how social media can help brand your business for greater growth. They share their thoughts with our correspondent Patricia Cesaire. From there, we talk to Vernice "FlyGirl" Armour, the first african american combat pilot who shows how lessons learned in the battle field help make her successful as an entrepreneur. And finally, we profile a different side to Hip Hop Rap star, Fat Joe, who is helping his young people in his community grow up to be financially successful.

programme.title: Lynae Vanee Talks Power, Purpose, and 'The People’s Brief'
programme.desc: Multi-hyphenate creator, poet, and cultural commentator Lynae Vanee steps into the spotlight as the host of "The People’s Brief," REVOLT’s raw and unapologetic news commentary series. In this exclusive Black Enterprise interview with Selena Hill, the three-time NAACP Image Award nominee shares her journey from high school teacher to digital powerhouse, and unpacks her vision for truth-telling, creative freedom, and the future of Black America.

programme.title: Bigfoot: Living Creature or Legendary Lie?
programme.desc: Bigfoot. Sasquatch. Yeti. Yeren.Yowie. There are reports the world over of these terrifying creatures. This program shows a chilling eyewitness encounter plus scientific analysis of the creature’s footprints providing startling insights into this mystery.

programme.title: Asteroid Collision: Doomsday Destruction or Passing Apprehension?
programme.desc: There are over 31,000 known meteor impact sites on Earth with craters up to 186 miles in diameter. Some experts say an impact doomsday scenario is science fiction. Others say it is only a question of ’when’. Could humanity survive? Could Earth survive?

programme.title: Tales of the Dead: Grim Stories of Curses, Horror and Gore
programme.desc: Five friends gather on Halloween to continue their ritual of telling horror stories. Each one telling a more sinister tale than the next, unaware of the horror that awaits them on this all Hallows eve. A film from award winning director Kemal Yildirim. Less is More: May Walker suffers from a disorder known as BIID (Body Integrity Identity Disorder). She has a constant desire to be an amputee to feel complete. She struggles to cope until one day when a mysterious doctor makes her an offer that’s impossible to refuse. (Awarded top 10 in the Zone Horror competition and shown at Fright Fest) Wolf Cry: Zack is a slacking teenager who is obsessed with horror movies to the point where nothing else matters. His constant daydreaming derails his life until one night he experiences something that profoundly changes his world forever. Penance: The city is in the grip of a sadist serial killer. Detective Klein is a recovering alcoholic whose career is in tatters until he is chosen by the serial killer to play a horrifying game of cat and mouse. Missing: Five friends investigating an ancient curse on Cromwell Street in England discover far more than they bargained for when they unknowingly unleash a dark force that has been lying dormant for centuries. Includes Special Features

programme.title: 3:15 AM
programme.desc: LONG - Horror strikes at 3:15 AM in ways never before imagined. Truth is stranger than fiction in this euro horror anthology that opens a new dimension in sheer terror. This cutting edge horror anthology from France will curl your toes and rattle your soul.

programme.title: Angel Maker: Serial Killer Queen
programme.desc: In the 19th century, England controlled the biggest Empire the world had ever seen. Scientific breakthroughs, huge scale engineering, and great leaps in medicine led Britain's reign of global power. And yet, behind the facade there was a darkness. An unimaginable world of evil - theft, rape, murder and more. This was the real world of Jack the Ripper and Sherlock Holmes. But there was a lesser known killer on the loose who was far worse than any of the others, a woman who would succeed in becoming one of the world's most prolific serial killers. Her name was Amelia Dyer and she killed over 400 innocent babies. A seemingly gentle old lady, Amelia would take in children under the guise of nurturing and caring for them when in reality she starved and strangled them to death. Explore inconceivable recesses of humanity in this shockingly true story of human darkness and depravity at the turn of the century.

programme.title: Preview for "Lamb Cam"
programme.desc: For the kid in all of us! Relax in the company of frolicking lambs and their moms in a spring meadow. Filmed on the remote north coast of Sea Ranch, California. This relaxation film is accompanied by a comforting soundtrack of bird songs and sheep baas. To view on your TV, access our free NatureStream.tv apps for all platforms at www.NatureStream.tv

programme.title: Preview for "Autumn Exhilaration" 2 Hour Nature Film
programme.desc: Available on October 30th, 2021 -The exhilaration of autumn in the Colorado Rockies and High Sierras awaits you in our latest film release! Soar over the brilliant aspen forests of Colorado, immerse yourself in the glowing autumn leaves, and bask in the golden light of sunrise on the high mountain peaks. The inspiring scenery is accompanied by a soothing ambient music soundtrack. Available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv. Runtime 2.5 Hours.

programme.title: Preview for "Winter Wonder, Swiss Alps" Relaxing Nature Film
programme.desc: Journey through breathtaking mountain beauty in the 90 minute long "Winter Wonder, Swiss Alps". Experience sunrise on the Matterhorn, exhilarating aerial views of mountain peaks, and wondrous ice sculptures deep in glacial caves. A tranquil soundtrack accompanies the awe inspiring scenery at "the top of Europe". Available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv

programme.title: Magic of Zion
programme.desc: Experience the magnificent Zion National Park in its autumn splendor! Brilliant autumn colors combine with the warm red tones of Zions dramatic cliffs to create a visual feast like no other in" Magic of Zion". Also included is rare footage of the endangered American Condor, the largest flying land bird in North America. Watch as a wild parent Condor feeds and nurtures its fledgling on the cliffs of Zion, an awe inspiring sight since there used to be only 50 condors in existence. Available now to subscribers of NatureStream.tv. Runtime 82 minutes.

programme.title: Pro Boxing Archive Series
programme.desc: Ray Mancini vs Livingstone Bramble 1 from June 1, 1984

programme.title: Ballroom Boxing
programme.desc: Jimmy Lange vs James Johnson and more

programme.title: Pro Boxing Archive Series
programme.desc: Wilfredo Gomez vs Rocky Lockridge from May 19, 1985

programme.title: Pro Boxing Archive Series
programme.desc: Joel Julio vs Jamaal Davis from August 21, 2010

programme.title: Winona Ryder vs. Johnny Depp
programme.desc: S1: E10 Johnny Depp’s trial with Amber Heard had everyone talking, but wait until you hear about Winona Ryder’s. Johnny experienced love at first sight and became obsessed with Winona. But after their breakup, Winona dealt with mental health issues and her own very public trial, which has some striking similarities with Johnny and Ambers. Everyone thought she was a crazy, and the aftermath of her court case left her banished from the world. Winona went through a great awakening outside of the public eye and bounced back into Hollywood.

programme.title: Amber Rose vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E5 it true that Kanye West was harassing Amber Rose when she suddenly left him? When Kanye West started dating Amber Rose, he took her from the life of being a stripper to the global superstar world. At first, they seemed like a couple that was truly in love. But when Amber suddenly left Kanye, his attitude towards her completely changed. Our team uncovered the real story behind the tabloids of the years of bullying, unwanted media attention, and attacks that Amber had to suffer. The true story will reveal why she was the special woman Kanye fell in love with in the first place, and what she and Kim Kardashian have in common.

programme.title: Ariana Grande vs. Pete Davidson
programme.desc: S1:E11 What made Kanye West go to war against Pete Davidson? Kanye is relentlessly going after Pete, so much so, that Kim Kardashian is concerned about the safety of her new boyfriend. Is it because Kanye knows Pete’s history of controversial relationships? Our team got the real story behind the tabloids, the truth behind Pete’s behavior in relationships, and the journey he went on to truly start loving who he is.

programme.title: Drake Bell vs. Josh Peck
programme.desc: S1:E15 Everyone loved Drake & Josh but people don’t know the dark story behind the world’s favorite kids’ show. Josh struggled with his weight and addiction while filming the show. It was always painful for him to be the chubby sidekick to the cool, popular Drake. Then Josh shocked the world when he revealed that he and Drake weren’t even really friends. Drake was furious, sparking a massive backlash against Josh. But no one knew just how dark of a path Drake had gone down.

programme.title: The Rise Of Fredia Gibbs
programme.desc: S1:E6 Fredia Gibbs was the first female African American kickboxing world champion who learned how to fight as a child because she grew up scared and afraid. It wasn’t until she unknowingly got into a van alone after a party with a man who turned out to be a serial killer, that all the years of fighting and training would help her unleash the power she had inside of her and catapult her to new heights.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise of Jonny Kim
programme.desc: S1:E3 From the outside, Jonny Kim looks like one of the most ambitious people you’ll ever hear about. A person who can become a Navy SEAL, a doctor and an astronaut all before the age of 40 must be a confident, talented person. However, Jonny didn’t grow up aspiring to be a highly trained soldier-doctor capable of going to outer space. It was only until he experienced one of the darkest, most traumatic things a child could go through, that he discovered a calling way bigger than himself.

programme.title: Katie Beers: The Girl In The Wall
programme.desc: Spaceplex is 9 year old Katie Beers’ favorite spot, before she’s abducted at that same location in December 1992, just before her birthday. For 17 days, the investigators dig into the family’s lies, each more suspicious than the next, hoping to find the lost girl. Katie is trapped in the wall, but she still has her wits, which will eventually lead to justice against her kidnappers.

programme.title: Real Stories With Wim Hof
programme.desc: In this bonus exclusive Goalcast interview, find out what Wim Hofs mother said to him at a very young age that drives every move he makes. Wim Hof is a world record breaker and a global phenomenon. He is famous for his superhuman ability to perform extreme long-distance swimming under freezing water. But the Iceman believes he has a special calling in the world.

programme.title: Chanel Miller: Write Your Own Story
programme.desc: As the press called her Emily Doe & his legal team tried to frame her assailant Brock Turner as the "star athletes with everything to lose," Chanel Miller remained anonymous. What pushed her to break her silence during the final days of Turners trial? And how did her powerful statement about her sexual assault give a voice to survivors around the world?

programme.title: GSP: Behind The Mask
programme.desc: As a child, Georges St-Pierre was bullied relentlessly by an older and much bigger boy at his school. He was tortured, and humiliated on a daily basis, leading to years of built up anger and frustration. It was this traumatizing childhood experience that led him to study martial arts and become one of the most celebrated UFC Champions in the world. Years later, Georges faced his childhood bully once again. What he chose to do in that moment is nothing short of amazing.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay: Karma is Served
programme.desc: Blind chef, Christine Ha, shocked the nation when she tried out for the reality show cooking competition, Masterchef. Perhaps even more surprising was Gordon Ramsay’s scandalous reaction. She made him eat his words on national tv and made Masterchef history!

programme.title: Escaping North Korea: The Search for Freedom
programme.desc: Yeonmi Park was deprived of her childhood and forced to grow up far too quickly in horrifying circumstances under the tyrannical regime of KIM JONG-UN. When she was smuggled out of North Korea she hoped to find freedom and a better life, but things only got worse. This is her story.

programme.title: Christine Ha: Courage in the Kitchen
programme.desc: In this exclusive Goalcast Original, the first blind contestant and winner of MasterChef, Christine Ha, opens up about how she lost her sight and her mother at a young age. These formative experiences shaped who she is today and pushed her to never give up on her dreams and finding ways to connect with the spirit of her mother.

programme.title: Muhammad Ali's Biggest Fight
programme.desc: Muhammad Ali, a man of conviction and great coherence. He was exactly who he said he was, a brilliant mind who never hesitated to put others first, a truly free man! A documentary made to inspire and motivate.

programme.title: Blue or Red pill?
programme.desc: Mindvalley founder Vishen Lakhiani shares the secret to success and teaches a confused student how to make the right decisions in life. The choice is yours: Will you take the blue pill or the red pill?

programme.title: From Thief to Self-Made Millionaire
programme.desc: Watch John Assarafs personal story of growth, the lessons he learned early on in life, and how he went from robber to self-made millionaire by brushing his teeth.

programme.title: Medicare Do's and Don'ts That SAVE (or COST) YOU Money!
programme.desc: Are you ready for Medicare Enrollment season? Its that time of the year, and Marvin Musick from Medicare School is here to guide you through the essential Dos and Donts. Whether youre turning 65 or researching what to do this annual enrollment period, you MUST watch this video! He tells you exactly why timing is absolutely crucial when it comes to enrolling in Medicare and shows you the strategies that can help you delay enrollment without penalties if youre working for a larger employer and do not exactly NEED Medicare right now. Marvin also gives you vital details on the often-overlooked importance of Part D even if youre not currently on medications, its your insurance for the future! What are Advantage Plans, and how do you navigate income-related premiums after life-changing events?

programme.title: Ranking The BEST Supplemental Plans For 2024! (Medigap Plan Ranking!)
programme.desc: Are you on the verge of making YOUR important Medicare decisions for 2024? Today, Marvin Musick from Medicare School, will guide you through the best and the worst of each Medicare supplemental plans so that you can make the best decision for your personal circumstances! There are a world of options and carriers available, its Crucial to ensure Youre making the Right Choice for Your Unique Healthcare Needs. Marvin will not only break down the top three supplemental plans F, G, and N but also go over essential facts on how to select the ideal plan based on your birthdate, budget preferences, and the long-term stability of insurance rates.

programme.title: Navigating Change
programme.desc: "Jeanniey Walden is joined by sesame Street for laughter and love talks, Lara Eurdolian for bulding your business and youve got to hear how Lynwood Bibbens, CEO of ReachTV stays ahead of the competition."

programme.title: Expert in their Fields
programme.desc: Jeanniey Walden chats with star and animal lover Mandy Moore as well as experts in the fields of corporate espionage and audiology.

programme.title: Root Financial: When should you consider a roth conversion
programme.desc: Roth Conversions can be an incredible strategy to save tens of thousands (if not hundreds of thousands in taxes) when executed appropriately. So, when does it make sense to implement Roth Conversions?

programme.title: The Dark Side of Early Retirement
programme.desc: The idea of early retirement has captured the attention of many, leading to the pursuit of FIRE, which stands for Financial Independence Retire Early. The concept of financial independence is undoubtedly appealing, but theres a shadow lurking in the background of the FIRE movement that often goes unnoticed. James explains the dark side of FIRE and discuss how to avoid it.

programme.title: What is Medicare?
programme.desc: Thats the question, WHAT is medicare? In this video we are going to take a moment to address that question. You will get a brief overview of what Medicare is. Including Medicare Part A, Medicare Part B, and the two main ways people use this coverage through Medigap Supplemental Plans and Advantage Plans. This is a great Video to get a base knowledge of these two systems and how they work.

programme.title: Episode 2: How does a group plan work with Medicare?
programme.desc: Making sure how your insurances work together is very important in retirement, you do not want to leave gaps in coverage. In the second half of this episode, we will discuss how to avoid mistakes with COBRA.

programme.title: Inspiration
programme.desc: "Inspiration in business plays a crucial role in driving innovation, motivation, and long-term success. It acts as a catalyst that encourages entrepreneurs and teams to think creatively, overcome obstacles, and pursue their goals with passion. Whether drawn from personal experiences, mentors, or the vision of creating something new, inspiration fuels the perseverance needed to navigate the challenges of the business world.Jeanniey is joned by experts to help viewers evolve and thrive in a constantly changing landscape."
